name: NPR
text:
We get fed a lot of stories about sports as a path for upward social mobility. But the vast majority of sports offered at elite schools cater to mostly white, middle class kids. @OnlyAGameNPR
https://t.co/ffr1Xn1EEq

name: NPR
text: The revelation that Tucker Carlson's top writer had posted racist, sexist and homophobic sentiments online for years has led to renewed scrutiny of the Fox News host's own commentaries. Carlson is set to address the controversy Monday. https://t.co/kXGckPJCk4

name: NPR
text:
George Archer was a pro golfer for nearly 50 years. But it wasn't until after his death in 2005 that his secret was revealed: 

He had dyslexia â€” undiagnosed and untreated. @OnlyAGameNPR
https://t.co/qylfHvfAiF

name: NPR
text: Grammarians are up in arms over dictionaries including "irregardless." The Merriam-Webster dictionary responds: "We do not make the English language, we merely record it." https://t.co/gWfldI0Bka

name: NPR
text:
In 2007, U.S. Border Patrol officers detained 76 Indians at the U.S.-Mexico border. Last year, that number exceeded 7,600. 

U.S. and Indian officials have been trying to figure out why.
https://t.co/vY7rBObClV

name: NPR
text:
Rats are usually eager to help in a crisis, but that urge quickly disappears if they're in the company of passive bystanders, new research finds. 

That's very similar to how humans behave.  
 https://t.co/tg7X8GWWq3

name: NPR
text:
What makes a true apology? What does it mean to make amends for past mistakes? 

This @TedRadioHour: speakers explore how repairing the wrongs of the past is the first step toward healing for the future. https://t.co/dTPqeezuCP

name: NPR
text: In a fashion first, this season's couture collections were presented online. It was a chance to experiment â€” like Dior's painstakingly crafted mini collection, displayed on dolls rather than models. https://t.co/IuDECeJShB

name: NPR
text:
A historian stumbled upon newspaper columns written by Lou Gehrig in 1927. They reveal a side of the former Yankees player that few saw. @OnlyAGameNPR 
https://t.co/LnmIxyacG1

name: NPR
text:
Jameela Jamil arrived in LA, went on one audition, booked the job and became a star on the sit-com "The Good Place" â€” a totally typical, not at all out of the ordinary Hollywood story!

Hear her get quizzed on @waitwait.
 https://t.co/0ldW7pT935

name: NPR
text:
Review: An outbreak story released amid a pandemic, "Survivor Song" feels (depressingly) like it might've been a non-fiction story if things today and yesterday had gone just a little bit differently than they did.

Plus zombies.
https://t.co/35PJTuIMLK

name: NPR
text:
More than 1,000 employees at the CDC have signed a letter calling for the agency to address "ongoing and recurring acts of racism and discrimination" against Black employees.

It also calls for the CDC to declare racism a public health crisis in the U.S.
https://t.co/Sv7EXzjFuh

name: NPR
text:
An NPR analysis finds that at least 65,000 absentee or mail-in ballots have been rejected this year because they arrived past deadlineâ€”often through no fault of the voter.

And while it's a relatively small number, they could prove crucial in a close race.
https://t.co/9j66byT0YG

name: NPR
text: Just in: Washington, D.C.'s NFL team has announced it is officially retiring its name and logo â€” which is widely viâ€¦ https://t.co/Lr2WwfNOwG

name: NPR
text:
The team has not announced what the new name would be. It said team owner Dan Snyder and head coach Ron Rivera are working together to develop a new name.
https://t.co/gXWJv6jFJg

name: NPR
text:
To take control of the Senate, Democrats will need to net three seats in November if Joe Biden wins, and four if President Trump is reelected.

That once looked nearly unachievable. Now, it's becoming a real possibility.
https://t.co/tXJur9SVKU

name: NPR
text:
Poland's conservative president Andrjez Duda has narrowly won reelection â€” further calling into question the country's commitment to western-style democracy.

The ruling party has worked to weaken the country's independent judiciary and free press.
https://t.co/q3m4lG7hD5

name: NPR
text:
Jeff Sessions is fighting for his political life as he tries to reclaim his old Senate seat. The 73-year-old is facing political newcomer and former football coach Tommy Tuberville, who's been backed by President Trump.
https://t.co/3zGvBaq2L1

name: NPR
text:
Coronavirus cases are rising in 48 places in the U.S., an NPR analysis shows.

text: Coronavirus cases are on the rise in many states â€”Â and the death toll is increasing, too. Experts say the recent suâ€¦ https://t.co/OFtMxTbosZ

text:

name: NPR
text:
A federal judge has blocked federal executions scheduled for this week, just hours before they were set to resume.

The government is likely to appeal her ruling.
https://t.co/5qMzAfHCU7

name: NPR
text:
A fire continues to burn on a U.S. Navy warship docked in San Diego, after an explosion on Sunday. At least 57 people were injured.
https://t.co/QX2KHNQTfB

name: NPR
text:
New York City had its first day since March without a COVID-19 death.  

"It's very hard to take a victory lap," Mayor Bill de Blasio says, calling on President Trump to invoke the Defense Production Act to speed processing of coronavirus tests. 
https://t.co/5gQ8VQptza

name: NPR
text: The Ventura County Sheriff's Department says that a body was recovered from Lake Piru where actress Naya Rivera was last seen.  https://t.co/lCa0CWduzX

name: NPR
text:
Once again challenging the expertise of his top public health officials, President Trump retweeted a conspiracy theory that claimed the CDC is lying about the coronavirus pandemic to hurt the president in November's election.
https://t.co/AfMzcbhcG6

name: NPR
text:
"Disclosure" is a new documentary on Netflix celebrating the long and complicated history of transgender people in cinema â€” looking as far back as 1914.

It takes a deep look into how some of that troubled past has shaped biases against trans people today.
https://t.co/AAZhFexet2

name: NPR
text:
Amid spike in coronavirus cases, South Africa has banned the sale of alcohol and reinstated a curfew to reduce alcohol-related incidents and open up hospital beds for COVID-19 patients.
https://t.co/JR0KqcnnKi

name: NPR
text:
BREAKING: The body of "Glee" actor Naya Rivera has been recovered from Lake Piru, the Ventura County Sheriff's Office confirms. She had gone missing while boating last week.
https://t.co/gmIboUybUt

name: NPR
text:
Los Angeles and San Diego public schools will start the new school year online, citing "skyrocketing infection rates."

The decision comes amid pressure from the federal government to open for in-person learning.
https://t.co/Rh2yglFaz1
